016package de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.property.util;
017
018import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.immutableList;
019import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.immutableSet;
020import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.immutableSortedSet;
021import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.mutableList;
022import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.mutableSet;
023
024import java.util.Collection;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Optional;
027import java.util.Set;
028import java.util.SortedSet;
029
030import de.cuioss.test.generator.impl.CollectionGenerator;
031import lombok.AccessLevel;
032import lombok.Getter;
033import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
034
035/**
036 * Used for static intersection of collection-types.
037 *
038 * @author Oliver Wolff
039 */
040@RequiredArgsConstructor(access = AccessLevel.PRIVATE)
041@SuppressWarnings("squid:S1452") // owolff: No type information available at this level,
042                                 // therefore the wildcard is needed
043public enum CollectionType {
044
045    /** Represents a {@link Collection}. The implementation will return a list. */
046    COLLECTION(Collection.class) {
047
048        @Override
049        public Iterable<?> nextIterable(final CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator) {
050            return collectionGenerator.list();
051        }
052
053        @Override
054        public Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(final Iterable<?> iterable) {
055            return mutableList(iterable);
056        }
057
058        @Override
059        public Iterable<?> emptyCollection() {
060            return immutableList();
061        }
062
063    },
064    /** Represents a {@link List}. */
065    LIST(List.class) {
066
067        @Override
068        public Iterable<?> nextIterable(final CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator) {
069            return collectionGenerator.list();
070        }
071
072        @Override
073        public Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(final Iterable<?> iterable) {
074            return mutableList(iterable);
075        }
076
077        @Override
078        public Iterable<?> emptyCollection() {
079            return immutableList();
080        }
081
082    },
083    /** Represents a {@link Set}. */
084    SET(Set.class) {
085
086        @Override
087        public Iterable<?> nextIterable(final CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator) {
088            return collectionGenerator.set();
089        }
090
091        @Override
092        public Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(final Iterable<?> iterable) {
093            return mutableSet(iterable);
094        }
095
096        @Override
097        public Iterable<?> emptyCollection() {
098            return immutableSet();
099        }
100
101    },
102    /** Represents a {@link SortedSet}. */
103    SORTED_SET(SortedSet.class) {
104
105        @Override
106        public Iterable<?> nextIterable(final CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator) {
107            return collectionGenerator.sortedSet();
108        }
109
110        @Override
111        public Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(final Iterable<?> iterable) {
112            return immutableSortedSet(iterable);
113        }
114
115        @Override
116        public Iterable<?> emptyCollection() {
117            return immutableSortedSet();
118        }
119
120    },
121    /**
122     * 'Marker' type for arrays. The operations will always throw an
123     * {@link UnsupportedOperationException}. It is designed as a marker and can not
124     * be used directly
125     */
126    ARRAY_MARKER(Iterable.class) {
127
128        @Override
129        public Iterable<?> nextIterable(final CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator) {
130            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
131        }
132
133        @Override
134        public Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(final Iterable<?> iterable) {
135            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
136        }
137
138        @Override
139        public Iterable<?> emptyCollection() {
140            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
141        }
142
143    },
144    /**
145     * 'null' type for this enum. The operations will always throw an
146     * {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
147     */
148    NO_ITERABLE(Iterable.class) {
149
150        @Override
151        public Iterable<?> nextIterable(final CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator) {
152            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
153        }
154
155        @Override
156        public Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(final Iterable<?> iterable) {
157            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
158        }
159
160        @Override
161        public Iterable<?> emptyCollection() {
162            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
163        }
164
165    };
166
167    @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
168    @Getter
169    private final Class<? extends Iterable> iterableType;
170
171    /**
172     * Will create a corresponding type out of the given Generator
173     *
174     * @param collectionGenerator to be used, must not be null
175     * @return a type-corresponding iterable with random size between 4 and 12
176     */
177    public abstract Iterable<?> nextIterable(CollectionGenerator<?> collectionGenerator);
178
179    /**
180     * Will wrap the given iterable in to the corresponding collection-type
181     *
182     * @param iterable to be used, must not be null
183     * @return a type-corresponding iterable
184     */
185    public abstract Iterable<?> wrapToIterable(Iterable<?> iterable);
186
187    /**
188     * Returns an empty immutable instance of the corresponding collection-type
189     *
190     * @return a type-corresponding iterable
191     */
192    public abstract Iterable<?> emptyCollection();
193
194    /**
195     * Finds a concrete implementation for a given <em>Interface</em> that is to at
196     * least {@link Collection}. A special case is the dealing with Arrays
197     *
198     * @param type to be checked
199     * @return {@link Optional} of the type
200     */
201    public static final Optional<CollectionType> findResponsibleCollectionType(final Class<?> type) {
202        if (null == type || type.isEnum()) {
203            return Optional.empty();
204        }
205        if (type.isArray()) {
206            return Optional.of(ARRAY_MARKER);
207        }
208
209        if (!type.isInterface() || !Iterable.class.isAssignableFrom(type)) {
210            return Optional.empty();
211        }
212        for (final CollectionType collectionType : SEARCH_ORDER) {
213            if (collectionType.iterableType.isAssignableFrom(type)) {
214                return Optional.of(collectionType);
215            }
216        }
217        return Optional.empty();
218    }
219
220    private static final List<CollectionType> SEARCH_ORDER = immutableList(SORTED_SET, SET, LIST, COLLECTION);
221}
